wikipedia_page.main: Ray Hicks (3 March 1917 – 12 January 1974) was a British cyclist. He competed in the sprint and time trial events at the 1936 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1936 Summer Olympics

response: Lenard Ray Hicks (August 29, 1922 – April 20, 2003) was an Appalachian storyteller who lived his entire life on Beech Mountain, North Carolina. He was particularly known for the telling of Jack Tales.
Ray Hicks was born on August 29, 1922 in Banner Elk, North Carolina. He was the fourth of 11 children of Nathan and Rena Hicks. He had Cherokee ancestry, traced through his great-grandmother.
